title: The K Weakest Rows in a Matrix
content: Given a matrix of ones (representing soldiers) and zeros (representing civilians), return the indexes of the weakest rows in the matrix ordered from the weakest to the strongest. A row i is weaker than row j, if the number of soldiers in row i is less than the number of soldiers in row j, or they have the same number of soldiers but i is less than j. Soldiers are always stand in the frontier of a row, that is, always ones may appear first and then zeros. is either 0 or 1.
